author: wsjcom
title: Feelings Are Fine, But a Consensus Is Divine
text:
Rather than looking to feelings as the basis for what now directs political discourse and social values (“It’s the Era of Feelings, and Not Necessarily Good Ones,” op-ed, May 5), Prof. Paula Marantz Cohen should have touched more on what underscores those feelings: the rejection of logical or moral imperatives which govern decision-making, reason, discipline and objectivity. Without those verities, people grow older but they remain as irresponsible as children.
Philosophical and lingual deconstruction is an attempt, conscious...
